Title: Keep Calm and Cherry On
Message: You are part of a long history of learning and traditions at UW. While Gothic architecture and Huskies are key to our identity, nothing says UW better than the annual blooming of the Yoshino cherry trees in the Quad. What traditions have you established?
Try This: Take a walk among the pink trees, connect with the campus community and use #ThriveUW to share photos and videos of your own traditions.

Title: Springboard Your Sophomore Self
Message: Now is a good time to imagine your next year and begin taking steps to shape it.
Try This: Consider: What activities would complement your studies? Where would you like to live? How can you grow your network? Take time to write down your vision and identify next steps.

Title: Fail Forward
Message: What have you learned from challenges you've faced this year? Viewed in the right light, challenges--even failure--can help you develop an attitude of healthy resilience.
Try This: Learn the difference between a "fixed" vs. "growth" mindset. How can you apply these concepts to your own life? Attend a UW Resilience Lab event to learn more.

Title: People Power: Connections Count
Message: The people who influence and challenge your thinking play a significant role in your UW experience.
Try This: Reflect on your freshman year so far. Seek out faculty and courses that will add to the breadth and richness of your UW story and your Husky Experience.

Title: Research Made Easier
Message: Another research paper? Librarians can help you organize information and keep track of your sources, saving time in the process.
Try This: Create a personal citation database to store and share research citations, insert footnotes in your papers, and create bibliographies in seconds. See a librarian for more tips and tools.

Title: Experience is Golden
Message: Summer jobs (& internships!) can help you explore interests, develop skills, build professional relationships, and enhance your marketability for future opportunities.Â Making some money is always nice too!
Try This: Think creatively about a range of jobs and internships that can add to your knowledge and skills. Apply broadly -- trust that each option will provide unique benefits and rewards.

Title: De-stress with Mindfulness
Message: The school year is ending, and stress and anxiety may be on the rise. Practicing mindfulness can boost immunity, increase attention span, and decrease stress.
Try This: Mindful breathing can help calm nerves. Close your eyes; take ten slow deep breaths. Inhale through your nose; exhale through your mouth. Focus carefully on each breath.
Title 2: Video: UW students talk about mental health and resources

Title: Make the Most of Your Summer
Message: There are lots of ways to gain experience and give back over the next few months. Summer break can be much more than binge watching tv or playing video games!
Try This: Consider volunteering your time, getting involved with research, or mentoring youth. For more ideas or advice on how to get started, see the resources below or talk to an adviser.

Title: Celebrate Your Growth
Message: You made it!! Take a moment to appreciate all the ways you've grown--in classes and beyond--during your first year at UW.
Try This: What words of wisdom would you offer next year's incoming students? Share your advice - via words, photos and/or video using #ThriveUW.
